alert.note: Alert for Orange; Putnam; Rockland; Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 5:01PM EDT until July 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR PORTIONS OF THE LOWER HUDSON VALLEY... The National Weather Service in Upton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Orange County in southeastern New York... Western Putnam County in southeastern New York... Rockland County in southeastern New York... Northern Westchester County in southeastern New York... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 501 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Portions of the Lower Hudson Valley. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New City, Peekskill, Monsey, Nanuet, Haverstraw, Suffern, Monroe, West Point, Sloatsburg, Cold Spring, Pomona, Harriman, Spring Valley, Stony Point, Putnam Valley, Woodbury, West Haverstraw, Airmont, Congers and Chestnut Ridge. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
